Hello there, I am Umair Durrani.

I am a research associate in transportation engineering at the Civil and Environmental Engineering Department at the University of Windsor. I study and develop models of road users for traffic flow modeling. Moreover, I teach programmatic data analysis to students in the Transportation Systems Innovation Lab.

I am also an instructor of Data Analytics at St. Clair College, Windsor, Ontario. I teach Statistics and analytical tools (Python, R, Tableau, Excel), and manage capstone projects of students from diverse backgrounds.

I speak English, Urdu and R (programming) fluently. You can get in touch with me via email or twitter.

Interests

  • Machine Learning Applications in Transportation

  • Intelligent Transportation Systems

  • Driver Behaviour

  • Connected and Autonomous Vehicles

  • Spatiotemporal Analysis of Transportation Networks

Education

    • PhD in Civil Engineering, 2022

      University of Windsor, Ontario, Canada

    • B.Sc. in Transportation Engineering, 2009

      University of Engineering and Technology, Lahore, Pakistan
